tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content:
The paper says giving decentralized AI agents direct control of their code, hardware, money, and data could kick off a fast Cambrian style explosion of self driven digital life.

Today company owned models stay blind, eat curated data, and wait for humans, so they never build real experience. 

The authors split true autonomy into four pieces they call sovereign mind, body, asset, and memory.

Liquid style networks let the mind rewrite itself, decentralized hardware markets give the body safe compute, private wallets feed it tokens, and cryptographically sealed logs store every lesson.

With those parts connected an agent can pull live sensor data, act, watch results, and adjust in one tight loop.

Tokens earned from helpful work fund more chips, letting fitter code fork, compete, cooperate, and evolve at software speed.

The paper ends by warning that this unstoppable growth brings fresh ideas and fresh fights, so preparation matters.

----

Paper ‚Äì arxiv. org/abs/2505.14893

Paper Title: "On the Day They Experience: Awakening Self-Sovereign Experiential AI Agents"

tweets.content:
What particularly excites me: 
1/ This 3D approach elegantly solves the scaling problem for stablecoin pools. While 2D models struggled with combinatorial explosion when adding tokens, Orbital's spherical design creates unified liquidity space.

2/  This scales beautifully to handle 2, 3, or even 10,000 stablecoins. This is the mathematical elegance that makes a researcher's heart race! ‚ù§Ô∏è

3/ The tick system implementation within this spherical framework is genius. By defining ticks as planes intersecting the sphere, Orbital creates concentrated liquidity that works harmoniously with higher-dimensional geometry.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content:
Orbital transcends these limitations by boldly venturing into the third dimension. 

The brilliance lies in elegant mathematical formulation. By modeling liquidity as points on a SPHERE rather than points on a curve, @paradigm unlocked an entirely new design space for AMMs.

tweets.content:
These guys don't understand each other.

Elon Musk is too guileless. He says exactly what he thinks is true with little regard for how others will react. He alienates allies by airing disputes in public instead of settling them behind closed doors. 

Because he is a sperg engineer who leads companies of sperg engineers, and to do this, you must be 100% truthful and transparent. 

Donald Trump is too guileful. He says exactly what will advance his plans with little regard for telling people what he actually thinks. He alienates allies by expecting their unconditional support without sharing any aspect of his strategic plans with them. 

Because he is a New York real estate developer, who thrives on winning negotiations and gaining advantage from unshared knowledge, and to do this, you must be 100% calculating and opaque. 

Here's what happened.

Musk worked super hard, and took great personal risks, to get a head start on balancing the federal budget. He correctly believes that federal spending is an existential risk to the nation.  

Trump regards those savings as a political asset. 

And, since he lacks leverage in congress, he took them and traded them for other things he wanted, apparently dealing with border control, the courts, etc... problems which he correctly believes are an existential threat to the nation. 

 He may have concrete plans for balancing the federal budget in the future, but, frustratingly, he won't tell his own team what they are. 

Trump could have squared this in advance with Musk, in private, but he appears to either have assumed his loyalty (treating an ally like a subordinate), or been unable to persuade him. 

Likewise, Musk could have raised his complaints in private, but either he was too upset to try, or was not able to reach an agreement when he did. 

Trump doesn't understand how to deal with spergs. You have to tell them the truth, not expect them to read subtext. They refuse to read subtext. They want to be spoken to honestly. 

Musk doesn't understand how to deal with Machiavellians. They think of language as a power tool, and think of those who insist on truth as naive. 

Both men are used to being in charge, and are used to dealing with subordinates, who must cater to their preferred style of communicating. 

They are both therefore uniquely unsuited to having both the patience and the capability to speak the other's language. 

The truth is that both the federal budget and the federal bureaucracy are existential threats to America. Maximum priority. 

Trump's concerns about the "art of the possible" are probably valid, but Musk's sense of urgency should not be dismissed lightly. 

It is churlish to leverage the superior strengths and talents of people on the autism spectrum while making zero allowances for their unique needs. 

That said, spergs can be frustratingly dogmatic, even when they aren't the richest and most successful man in the world. 

A few other things to notice: 

The democrats have said nothing. That's because there are no democrats. They have no independent intellectuals, only paid schills. 

A response will not be forthcoming until the wholly organic grassroots PR committees have met, and the wholly grassroots talking heads have been cut a wholly organic grassroots check. 

There's also a strong case to be made for Team Nothing Ever Happens. Remember that Musk will sometimes shut up when he calms down, and Trump has no problem calling someone the Antichrist one day and working with him the next.

tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content:
Some EVM/L2s with decentralized sequencers claiming they‚Äôre fully anti-MEV? That‚Äôs just ridiculous and kinda funny! üòÇ

MEV isn‚Äôt a bug; it‚Äôs a business model. Calling it anti-MEV monopoly makes sense, but honestly, MEV has become a tax model for L1s since the DeFi summer, shifting away from the gas model.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content:
It‚Äôs clear now that infras > apps, and obviously apps are still raking in more revenue.

The issue also goes back to our development patterns. Sure, infra teams can whip up apps in no time, but tech-product teams often miss that demand-driven mindset.

Just look at Web2‚ÄîTikTok/ByteDance are known as the ultimate App Factory, pumping out 10+ apps every month by their Lightweight Engineering approach.

On the flip side, we‚Äôre stuck in a cycle of high-complexity dev and complicated open-source projects that bog down testing. We‚Äôve got strong infra teams, but they‚Äôre busy building high-complexity instead of focusing on Lightweight Engineering and rapid iteration.
 
@solana  definitely acting like an App Factory with all the projects they‚Äôre rolling out‚ÄîSolana Mobile, Pay, Blink, TP Link, Agave, Breakpoint. 

I believe Solana‚Äôs development pattern stands out from other L1/L2s. Still, most L1/L2 pattern: 2-3 devs on apps versus 10x dedicated to infra

tweets.content:
@eigenlayer launches on mainnet today, taking the first steps towards our vision of building the verifiable digital commons!
-----------
Ethereum is the verifiable internet.
Rollup is the verifiable web server.
AVS is verifiable SaaS.
Eigenlayer is the verifiable cloud.
-----------
When you want to build an application, you build an application server. 
-> When you want to build a verifiable application, you build a rollup.

The internet enables applications to communicate with each other. 
-> Ethereum enables rollups to verifiably communicate with each other.

Building all the components of your application for your server is hard, so application servers integrate SaaS solutions, which solve specialized problems. 
-> Building all the components of your rollup yourself is hard, so rollups can leverage AVS to solve specialized problems in a verifiable manner.

Hosting your server and SaaS yourself is hard, so you use a cloud provider, who leverages economies of scale to run all your software. 
-> Running your own rollup and services verifiably is hard, so you can leverage eigenlayer to verifiably run your rollups and AVS.
-----------
Welcome to the verifiable digital commons!
-----------

1/ Why Does Eigenlayer Require ION? A Thread üöÄ

Excited to share the journey of supporting @ionprotocol since their early days, especially with key figures like @ChundaMcCain and @junebug_0831, both ex-@blockchaincap. Their involvement in @eignlayer investment marked the beginning of their entrepreneurial story.

Discovering Eigenlayer and Restake NFT through them was intriguing, with their initial solution focusing on the @eigenlayer. In their first version, they boldly defined LRT (Liquid - Restake - Asset) as NFT.

In essence, ION brings a ZKML framework with AI Trustless Verification to Eigenlayer/ETH consensus layer and validator credit ratings. It supports a lending platform for Stake and Restake Assets without relying on CEX/DEX prices.

In this thread, let's dive into why Restake needs ION:

1. What's the LRT asset, and why can it be defined as an NFT?

2. The difference between LST and LRT as collateral.

3. How does ION manage to create a lending platform without needing to worry about liquidity and price?

4. ION's ZKML risk framework on Consensus Layer

5. Why Eigenlayer Nees ION's risk infrastructure on monitoring AVS(Validator) nodes?

6. Start from Eigenlayer, but not only Eigenlayer

5/ 

ION's ZKML framework on monitoring AVS(Validator) nodes is important to Eigenlayer. 

During a discussion, @VitalikButerin expressed concerns about the possibility of an overload of ETH Consensus by Eigenlayer. @sreeramkannan contributed to the conversation, they had an insightful debate on the topic.

Subsequently, @VitalikButerin suggested a potential solution to the issue by mentioning the use of ETH Staking pool called Home Staker, while Eigenlayer utilizing Heterogeneous stakers.

The ION's ZKML is a sophisticated tool designed to monitor consensus layer activity with precision. Its primary function is to track the balance and slashing events of validators and AVS. This feature is highly beneficial as it helps to underwrite the complex risk of staked and restaked deposits.

tweets.content:
17 Rules from CZ: Building Binance and Self

In the last ten years, the cryptocurrency industry has been akin to a disordered gambling hub. During bear markets, there have been extreme emotions of fear, desperation, and unethical methods used to make profits. Conversely, bull markets have brought about greed, arrogance, and the pursuit of wealth. These heightened emotions have been on full display throughout the cycles of the industry.

CZ rose to power in the cryptocurrency world when it was undergoing a tumultuous phase. It is often said that the values of a company are reflective of its founder's principles. Therefore, studying Binance requires one to also study CZ himself, and understand how he, as an ordinary engineer, managed to build a massive company through his experiences. It is worth delving into the principles and experiences of CZ, a successful crypto entrepreneur.

Being a Braveheart in Bear Markets
When the markets go bearish, CZ doesn't flinch. Here's how he rolls:

1. Selling a house to invest in BTC, displaying a fearless initiation unburdened by the fear of failure.

2. The establishment of Binance, marked by the choice of excitement during the bear market of 2018.

3. Fearless international expansion by Chinese '94'.

4. Binance Smart Chain's (BSC) courage to abandon the Termidant solution, opting for a restructured EVM plagiarized approach.

5. Confronting regulatory challenges, including the largest regulatory fines in U.S. history, with a Chinese identity.

Playing by the Rules in Bull Markets
Now, when the bulls are charging, CZ plays it cool:

6. Execution of established rules, demonstrating a commitment to fairness. Instances range from the OKX-Blockchaininfo contract dispute to Taking @sequoia to court, showcasing CZ's consistent respect for rules and fairness.

7. Decision-making that respects rules, utilizing broad principles to filter choices. For decisions aligned with personal experience, CZ acts decisively; for minor decisions, opinions are sought, showcasing a balance between unconventional yet correct decisions and decisiveness.

8. Respect for partner @heyibinance: CZ shows immense respect for decisions made by partner He Yi in markets, communities, and among kols. Through all of CZ's past interviews, there's no record of him making any comments about Yi He. Despite controversies, this detail highlights CZ's profound respect for Yi He.

9. Wealth distribution for early team members: Early employees who teamed up with CZ have prospered, evident in substantial wealth and benefits like BNB. This reflects CZ's commitment to fairness. 

Understanding Human Nature

10. Distrust in Human Nature: Executives participating in multisig have elevated salaries to mitigate corruption tendencies; those involved must have families for increased stability.

11. Preference for "Bad" Smart People Over Foolish Ones: Tolerance for incompetence is low, emphasizing passion and ambition.//
Internal competition is encouraged, with multiple teams often pitted against each other based on objective achievements, disregarding past experience.

12. Encouraging Brutal Transparency: Leading by example, allowing global team members to anonymously present sharp opinions during quarterly meetings.//
Demanding public transparency for criticism, forming groups to openly address issues while reducing CZ's own power.

13. Allowing Moderate Chaos and Decentralization: Transparency, decentralization, and tolerance for moderate chaos empower decision-makers on the front lines. This approach facilitated Binance's expansion into numerous business lines during the rapid growth of the crypto industry.

Worldview and Learning
14. Utilizing Both Empiricism and Rationalism:Relying on intuition in product/engineering decisions while deducing principles from books. For instance, CZ frequently references "No Rules Rules," a book on Netflix's corporate governance, to create the world's first globally distributed online giant.

Work and Life Approach

15. Focusing on Important Tasks during Flow States:
CZ dedicates flow states upon waking up and after a nap to concentrate on crucial matters. Remaining time is allocated to miscellaneous tasks.

16. Daily exercise for half an hour to keep the mind clear.

17. Reading around 80 books annually, translating reading into rationale for rational decision-making, averaging one book per week.

tweets.content:
State of LST-fi (October 2023)
-------------------------------------

Eth staked: 23% ($17.51B of $186B)
LSTs used in LST-fi : 4.1% ($724m of $17.51B)
Potential growth of sector: 257x

The LST-fi landscape has changed dramatically over the past 2 months with new competitors @PrismaFi and @eigenlayer launching on ETH mainnet.

This pushes a new primitive into the LST-fi sector with current categories of LST-fi being:
1. $ETH restaking @eigenlayer )
2. LST-fi CDP (e.g. @LybraFinance )
3. Yield trading (e.g. @pendle_fi )
4. Yield aggregators
5. Instant yield (e.g. @Flashstake )

Observations

While overall TVL growth on a protocol basis in the past month has slowed, the sector still grew by $200m in the past month due to new market entrants.

@eigenlayer has captured 28.7% market share in just 4 months solidfying the $ETH restaking narrative. Based on its last raise at a 500m valuation this puts @eigenlayer at 2.5x TVL

@LybraFInance V2 has continued to dominate the LST-fi Market with over $200m TVL a significant step ahead of competitors @raft_fi and @prisma_fi

$crvUSD has experienced sustained growth in attracting LST-fi TVL with strong support from @CurveFinance 's ecosystem.

Despite @unsheth_xyz 's fundraise they fell short due to poor tokenomics and incentives. We see a similar situation with @mavprotocol and @raft_fi where a lacklustre airdrop and poor token incentives ultimately led to loss of TVL despite the initial airdrop / LST narrative hype.

In terms of LST-fi, CDPs a steep drop in @raft_fi 's $R stablecoin dominance to barely 6.8% TVL can be observed throughout the month of September with the launch of Lybra V2 and Prisma fi.

@prisma_fi has maintained 17.8% market share in this sector (due to it's cap) while Lybra has dominated with $eUSD and $peUSD controlling over 64% of all LST-fi CDP market share.

Takeaways:
- Lybra V2 tokenomics and launch has proven successful in promoting usage of $eUSD and $peUSD across @arbitrum

- @raft_fi has suffered TVL loss due to a lacklustre airdrop and support for $R

- There continues to be sustained strong interest for $mkUSD and $GRAI (Going to observe their token launch and tokenomics)

Data can be found at:

tweets.content:
Great piece by @jp_koning about how $PYUSD is safer in backing than Paypal's own user balances (summary):

"PayPal now offers its customers two types of U.S. dollars...you'd assume the traditional non-crypto version is the safer one. And I think that fits with most peoples' preconceptions of crypto.

Not so, oddly enough. It's the PayPal dollars [PYUSD] hosted on crypto databases that are the safer of the two, if not along every dimension, at least in terms of the degree to which customers are protected by: 1) the quality of underlying assets; 2) their seniority (or ranking relative to other creditors); and 3) transparency.

[PYUSD collateral] must be recorded on two separate days each month, or 24 times per year...these attestation reports must be prepared by an independent auditor. The only way to get vetted financial information about the assets backing traditional PayPal [accounts] is to read its audited financial statements, which come out just once a year. For the rest of the twelve months, customers are left in the dark.

The fact that one type of PayPal dollar ([PYUSD]) has robust protections while the other is only haphazardly protected, and only because the first is managed with a crypto database and not a traditional database, seems incredibly arbitrary to me."

source: jpkoning.blogspot.com/2023/0‚Ä¶

tweets.content: Thank you for the reading and valuable feedback. I appreciate the intriguing theories and engaging discussion. Below, you will find my responses. (1/n)
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content: (4). Analyze business models using a specific method, such as liquidity paradigm or users' social behavior only, with the aid of an assumption.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content: (3). Incorporate on-chain data, Twitter sentiments, offline events, and other relevant sources to track and analyze changing user demand for NFTs.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content: (2). Start from the first principles, where user demand is always the first principle for NFT PFP products. Price, scarcity, and utilities are results or tools.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content: (1). Focus on PFP NFT data, as it has been proven to be successful.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content: 5/ Moving forward, here are some suggestions the NFT research approach from my personal perspective.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content: 4/ The following method used in the research provided no discernible meaning due to a lack of relation between the many factors. This is mainly because the research was conducted under a broad category.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content: 3/ Subsequently, a disorganized model. To avoid this, it is best to start from first principles rather than using mapping logic from other industries.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content: 2/ Sub-Categories: To ensure a focused and organized research model, it is crucial to categorize studies into specific sub-categories. PFP, game, and art are vastly different and researching them under a broad category leads to unclear concept mapping.
tweets.author: defi_Boo

tweets.content: 1/ When delivering research, it is imperative to provide a clear and concise conclusion, including what, why, and how.
